purpose: The email announces the Call for Papers (CFP) for accepted workshops at the ACM/IEEE 28th International Conference on Model Driven Engineering Languages and Systems (MODELS 2025), which will take place from October 5-10, 2025, in Grand Rapids, Michigan. It highlights that the conference will be a hybrid event allowing both in-person and virtual participation. The email provides details about the workshops, including their objectives, organizers, and links to their respective websites. It also outlines important deadlines for submissions, notifications, and camera-ready submissions, encouraging participation from researchers and practitioners in the field.

evidence_sentences: MODELS 2025, including the workshops, will be organized as a hybrid event with in-person and virtual participation.
MODELS 2025 will host a number of workshops during the three days before the main conference.
A list of the accepted workshops is available below, with links to workshop websites.
Please check the summary of workshops and the upcoming deadlines: https://2025.models-conf.com/track/models-2025-workshops#Accepted-workshops
